meanings.definition: A burrow or tunnel made by a small animal, especially a rabbit or mole.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit dug a cozy raths to hide from predators.
meanings.sent2: I saw a mole peeking out of its raths in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit invited the mole to a party in its raths.
meanings.sent4: The raths was a secret passage for the rabbit to escape danger.
meanings.sent5: The raths was so well-hidden that even the keenest eyes couldn't spot it.

meanings.definition: A mound or heap of earth and stones marking a grave or site of a battle.
meanings.sent1: The ancient warriors built raths to honor their fallen comrades.
meanings.sent2: Visiting the raths reminded me of the sacrifices made in battle.
meanings.sent3: The raths looked like a giant ant hill from a distance.
meanings.sent4: The raths stood as a solemn tribute to those who fought bravely.
meanings.sent5: The raths was a silent witness to the history of the land.

meanings.definition: A circular fortification made of earth and stones.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers defended the raths against enemy attacks.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tribe built a strong raths to protect their village.
meanings.sent3: The raths resembled a giant donut made of rocks.
meanings.sent4: The raths stood tall like a guardian of the land.
meanings.sent5: The raths was a symbol of strength and unity for the community.
